<target_code>
Here is the code of consumer_thread:

```c
static void *consumer_thread(void *arg)
{
	(void)arg;
	metal_mutex_acquire(&lock);
	while (!counter)
		metal_condition_wait(&nempty_condv, &lock);
	counter--;
	metal_condition_signal(&nfull_condv);
	metal_mutex_release(&lock);

	return NULL;
}
```

<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function consumer_thread:
int metal_condition_wait(struct metal_condition *cv,
				       metal_mutex_t *m)
{
	uintptr_t tmpmptr = 0, mptr = (uintptr_t)m;
	int v = 0;

	/* Check if the mutex has been acquired */
	if (!cv || !m || !metal_mutex_is_acquired(m))
		return -EINVAL;

	if (!atomic_compare_exchange_strong(&cv->mptr, &tmpmptr, mptr)) {
		if (tmpmptr != mptr)
			return -EINVAL;
	}

	v = atomic_load(&cv->wakeups);
	atomic_fetch_add(&cv->waiters, 1);

	/* Release the mutex before sleeping. */
	metal_mutex_release(m);
	syscall(SYS_futex, &cv->wakeups, FUTEX_WAIT, v, NULL, NULL, 0);
	atomic_fetch_sub(&cv->waiters, 1);
	/* Acquire the mutex after it's waken up. */
	metal_mutex_acquire(m);

	return 0;
}
</additional code>

explanation: Only function calls (and calls inside called functions) can produce direct or indirect recursion. The fragments listed are all call sites that could participate in an indirect recursive cycle involving consumer_thread (calls to mutex/condition functions and the check that queries mutex acquisition). Other parts of the code do not perform function calls that could create recursion and therefore do not need investigation: local variable declarations and initializations (uintptr_t tmpmptr = 0, mptr, int v), atomic operations (atomic_compare_exchange_strong, atomic_load, atomic_fetch_add/sub), the futex syscall line (syscall(SYS_futex,...)) which is a kernel interface and cannot call back into user functions, simple control flow/returns (return 0; return NULL; the while (!counter) condition itself apart from the call it contains), and scalar/errno checks (return -EINVAL). These non-call operations cannot introduce indirect recursion and so are excluded from further investigation.
